page.title: 11The 'Old Mill'
page.content: Next to the church, by the side of the brook,can be found the 'Old Mill'. In 1985 the building, which was in a rather delapidated condition, was sold for re-development. It is presently undergoing conversion into three dwellings. The history of this fine building is rather interesting. It was originally built to replace a windmill which stood near and was used to grind corn and other cereals. A large dam was formed across the brook and the water held by the dam was used to drive the water wheel. When the pond was full of water it could drive the wheel for about 2 hours. A sound like continuous thunder could be heard when the mill was in use. A steam engine was also used to drive the mill. The mill was used up until about 1951 and the pond was filled in in 1954.
